page.title: 16Cornwall Copper Company
page.content: The Cornwall Copper Company used to {smelt copper}at its works in Hayle many years ago. When the copper was smelted the slag was made into large blocks called{scoria blocks.}There is a house made from scoria blocks and this was the works office. Many houses, walls and bridges were made out of these blocks. They were very heavy and cost 6 pence each.{Boats {came into a dock}near Daniel's Supermarket along the canal. Nearby is a road which leads to the Black Bridge which was made of scoria,one of the arches is bigger than the other so that the Vicar of Phillack could get his boat through.{The manager of the {C.C.C. was John Edwards.}He lived in Riviere House which was built in 1791. The company closed down many years ago.
